New Records: New Zealand posted their first 200-run total in a T20 World Cup
Tim Southee became the leading wicket-taker in men's T20Is, taking his tally to 3 more than Shakib Al Hasan's 122
Devon Conway hit the highest score in T20Is against Australia in T20Is with 92 not out
This is the first time New Zealand managed to post 200 runs in a T20 World Cup match
Key Match Events: New Zealand defeated Australia by 89 runs in Sydney
Devon Conway hit a match-winning 92 not out for New Zealand
Tim Southee picked up 3 wickets, including that of David Warner and Mitchell Marsh, while giving away just 6 runs
Mitchell Santner picked up 3 wickets, breaking the back of the Australian batting unit
Australia chased 200 but were bundled out for 111 in just 17.1 overs
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand's first win in Australia since 2011
New Zealand's biggest margin of defeat in terms of runs for Australia in T20Is is 89 runs
This is the first time New Zealand have won a men's T20I match in Australia
For the first time in 11 years, New Zealand managed to beat Australia in Australia across any format of the game
Others: Australia need to focus on improving their Net Run Rate as the 89-run defeat hampered their NRR, sinking it to -4.450
